energyAudits.title: What is an energy audit
energyAudits.details: An Energy Audit is a process that provides a systematic analysis of energy use and energy consumption within a defined energy audit scope, in order to identify, quantify, and report on the opportunities for improved energy performance.
energyAudits.cost: The Energy audit majorly when installed goes from ksh500,000 - 450,000 also it depends on the size of the house
energyAudits.benefits: This allows one or an institution to have improvements once recommended

energyAudits.title: Steps on an Energy audit
energyAudits.details: Step 1:There is a General Audit done ,Step 2: A walkthrough is done, Step 3: Investment grade audit is done
energyAudits.content: 1. Data collection on energy usage. 2. Building inspection. 3. Analysis of energy flows and losses. 4. Recommendations for improvements.
energyAudits.cost-saving: This enables a user to have reduction of energy management system of about 25%
energyAudits.duration: This takes 5-6 hours of installation(also depends on the area size of the compound or the field)

energyAudits.title: To have a professional energy auditor
energyAudits.details: Hiring a professional auditor provides a more thorough analysis of potential energy savings, identifying hidden inefficiencies such as air leaks, poor insulation, and inefficient appliances.
energyAudits.quality: The quality assurance of is certified by ERC and other government regulators
energyAudits.recommendations: Upgrade insulation, seal air leaks, replace outdated HVAC systems

solar energy.title: How solar panels work?
solar energy.content: They convert  sunlight into electricity using photovoltaic (PV) cells, which generate direct current (DC). This DC is converted to alternating current (AC) by an inverter, making it usable in homes, industries hospitals and buildings.
